subject: Writing
title: Banned Books Week: Celebrating Freedom
description: A short lesson to help you apply Banned Books Week: Celebrating Freedom.

hook.text: Every September, libraries across America celebrate the books people tried to silence. It's called Banned Books Week.

buildup.text: The American Library Association launched Banned Books Week in 1982 in response to a surge in book challenges.

discovery.text: Libraries display challenged books, host read-aloud events, and encourage people to read what others tried to ban.

twist.text: The event itself has been criticized â€” some argue it trivializes legitimate concerns about age-appropriate content.

climax.text: Despite criticism, Banned Books Week has become the most successful awareness campaign in library history.

punchline.text: The best revenge for a banned book is being read aloud.

quiz.question: When was Banned Books Week first launched?
